comment.text: The "CustomQuota" translation key is used to display a custom quota label in the filter section of the Home page. It is displayed when a user selects the "Custom Quota" option, indicating that they want to set their own quota threshold. The text appears on a dropdown or filter menu element.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Armenian translation "Հատուկ քվոտայով" translates to "with a special quota" rather than "custom quota." While not entirely wrong, it's not the most accurate representation of the English term. A more literal and accurate translation would be needed.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider "Պատվորվող քվոտա" (Patvorvogh Kvota) or "Մարժային քվոտա" (Marzhayin Kvota) which more closely align with "custom quota" depending on the specific context.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "カスタムな容量制限" (kustomo na ryouri gen) is not the most natural or precise translation of "Custom quota." While technically correct, it sounds somewhat awkward in Japanese. "カスタムクォータ" (kustomo kwo-ta) is a more common and direct transliteration/translation.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: カスタムクォータ (kustomo kwo-ta)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'අභිරුචි සලාකය' while containing relevant terms, doesn't perfectly capture the meaning of 'Custom quota'. 'අභිරුචි' (abiruchi) means 'taste' or 'preference,' which doesn't directly relate to a quota. 'සලාකය' (salakaya) means 'slice' or 'portion'. A more accurate translation would convey the concept of a quota being tailored or personalized.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using a translation like 'අභිරුචිගත ප්‍රමාණය' (abiruchigat pramanya) which translates to 'customized amount' or 'tailored quota'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "Poljubna kvota" is technically correct, it implies 'any quota' or 'arbitrary quota'. 'Custom quota' typically refers to a quota that is specifically tailored or defined by a user or organization, not just any quota. A better translation would reflect this specificity.
